title: The corpus of literature on the historical archaeology of capitalism is massive and is quickly growing. However, there are a few key recent texts of particular interest. For those interested in a concise overview of the field, see the textbook recently published by Charles Orser and Brian Pagan titled Historical Archaeology
Orser also provides an interesting read on comparative historical archaeology in his A Historical Archaeology of the Modern World
Several recent anthologies contain articles which examine material expressions of inequality
